===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|かさ|はこ|o1=ね|k2=ばこ|sort=かさねばこ|yomi=k|r=y}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かさねばこ}}. Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かさねばこ|重ね|tr1=kasane|t1=a pile, a tier, a ply|pos=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of classical verb {{m|ja|重ぬ}} ''kasanu'', modern {{m|ja|重ねる}} ''kasaneru'', “to make a pile of something, to stack something up”|箱|tr2=hako|t2=a box}}. {{rendaku2|sort=かさねはこ|hako|bako}}

This reading appears to be rare.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かさねばこ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かさねばこ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かさねばこ|rare}} [[tiered]] boxes for holding and presenting [[food]], such as {{m|ja|弁当|tr=bentō||[[bento]]}} or [[New Year's]] {{m|ja|お節|tr=osechi|pos=special dishes usually only served at the new year}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|じゅう|はこ|k2=ばこ|yomi=j|r=y}}
Origin less clear. Chinese-derived [[on'yomi]] {{m|ja|重|tr=jū||to stack}} + {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=じゅうばこ}} {{m|ja|箱|tr=hako||box}}. {{rendaku2|sort=しゅうばこ'|hako|bako}}

This is the standard reading for this term.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=j|じゅうばこ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じゅうばこ|hhira=ぢゆうばこ}}

# [[tiered]] boxes for holding and presenting [[food]], such as {{m|ja|弁当|tr=bentō||[[bento]]}} or [[New Year's]] {{m|ja|お節|tr=osechi|pos=special dishes usually only served at the new year}}
#: These are traditionally made of [[wood]] and often [[lacquered]], coming in [[set]]s designed to [[stack]] two, three, or even more layers high. Often [[square]], ''jūbako'' may also come in different shapes. A set usually comes with a [[lid]] for the top layer.

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|重箱で味噌を擂る|じゅうばこ で みそ を する}}: “grind miso in a ''jūbako''” → [[don't sweat the small stuff]]; excellent appearance, but inappropriate to the task at hand
* {{ja-r|重箱に鍋蓋|じゅうばこ に なべぶた}}: “a pot-lid on a ''jūbako''” → a [[square peg into a round hole]]
* {{ja-r|重箱に煮染め|じゅうばこ に にしめ}}: “boiled stew in a ''jūbako''” → looks great on the outside, not so good on the inside: [[appearances can be deceiving]]
* {{ja-r|重箱の隅を杓子で払え|じゅうばこ の すみ を しゃくし で はらえ}}: “clear out the corners of a ''jūbako'' with a ladle” → to [[see the forest for the trees]], [[don't sweat the small stuff]]
* {{ja-r|重箱の隅を楊枝でほじくる|じゅうばこ の すみ を ようじ で ほじくる}}: “to pick out the corners of a ''jūbako'' with a toothpick” → to [[split hairs]]
* {{ja-r|重箱を擂り粉木で洗う|じゅうばこ を すりこぎ で あらう}}: “clean a ''jūbako'' with a pestle” → [[see the forest for the trees]], [[don't sweat the small stuff]]
{{der-bottom}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|重箱読み|じゅうばこよみ}}: A reading of a kanji compound, consisting of an [[on'yomi]] for the first kanji and a [[kun'yomi]] for the second kanji.
* {{ja-l|重箱面|じゅうばこづら}}: a [[square]] [[face]]
{{der-bottom}}
